member.name: T:DevComponents.Tree.Cell
member.summary: Represents a cell assigned to the Node.

remarks.para: The Cell with Index 0 (zero) always exists for a Node and it is a cell that you can interact with through the properties on a node, which are forwarding to the Cell(0), or you can go directly to the Cell(0).
When Node has multiple columns defined each column corresponds to Cell in Node's Cells collection. The first Column has Index 0, second Column Index 1 and so forth.
Note that there is always at least one Cell in a Node even if multiple columns are not used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Cell.HostedControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the control hosted inside of the cell.

remarks.para: When control is hosted inside of the cell, cell size is determined by the size of the control hosted inside of it. The cell will not display its text but it will display any image assigned or check box when control is hosted inside of it. The Style settings like Margin and Padding will still apply.

member.summary: Gets or sets the style class assigned to the cell. Null value indicates that default style is used as specified on cell's parent.
member.value: Reference to the style assigned to the cell or null (VB Nothing) indicating that default style setting from tree control is applied. Default value is null.

For CellEditEnding event setting this property to true will keep the cell in edit mode.

member.summary: Gets or sets default cell image. Setting this property to valid image will override any setting of ImageIndex property.

remarks.para: The image set through this property will be serialized with the cell. If you plan to use ImageList then use ImageIndex property.

para.para: If you plan to use alpha-blended images we recommend using PNG-24 format which supports alpha-blending. As of this writting .NET Framework 1.0 and 1.1 do not support alpha-blending when used through Image class.

member.value: Image object or null (Nothing) if no image is assigned.

member.summary: Gets or sets the image that is displayed when mouse is over the cell. Setting this property to valid image will override any setting of ImageMouseOverIndex property.
member.remarks: If you plan to use alpha-blended images we recommend using PNG-24 format which supports alpha-blending. As of this writting .NET Framework 1.0 and 1.1 do not support alpha-blending when used through Image class.

member.summary: Gets or sets image that is displayed when Node that this cell belongs to is expanded. Setting this property to valid image will override any setting of ImageExpandedIndex property.
member.remarks: If you plan to use alpha-blended images we recommend using PNG-24 format which supports alpha-blending. As of this writting .NET Framework 1.0 and 1.1 do not support alpha-blending when used through Image class.

member.name: M:DevComponents.Tree.ElementStyle.ApplyStyle(DevComponents.Tree.ElementStyle)
member.summary: Applies a "child/inherited" style to this style. Use this method to create style hierarchies.
member.remarks: This method is used to support style hierarchies where a base style is defined and inherited/child styles are derived and based on it. By using this method on the base style you can apply only style changes defined by the child style. For example if you defined a base style for normal user interface element then in most cases you do not want to redefine the styling for the case when same user interface element is selected. You will just defined the behavior of the selected state and then apply it to the base normal style using ApplyStyle method.
member.param: Style to apply to current style.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.ElementStyle.BackColorSchemePart
member.summary: Gets or sets the color scheme color that is used as background color. Setting this property overrides the setting of the corresponding BackColor property. Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through BackColor property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.ElementStyle.MaximumWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum width of the element. This property should be used in conjunction with the WordWrap property to limit the size of text bounding box.
member.remarks: Default value is 0 which indicates that width of the style is not limited.

member.summary: Specifies the text be aligned near from the origin position of the element's rectangle. In a left-to-right layout, the near position is left. In a right-to-left layout, the near position is right.

member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned in the center of the element's rectangle.

member.name: F:DevComponents.Tree.eStyleTextAlignment.Far
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned far from the origin position of the element's rectangle. In a left-to-right layout, the far position is right. In a right-to-left layout, the far position is left.

member.name: F:DevComponents.Tree.eStyleTextTrimming.EllipsisPath
member.summary: The center is removed from trimmed lines and replaced by an ellipsis. The algorithm keeps as much of the last slash-delimited segment of the line as possible.

member.summary: Specifies that text is trimmed to the nearest word, and an ellipsis is inserted at the end of a trimmed line.

member.summary: Specifies no trimming.

member.name: F:DevComponents.Tree.eNodeRenderMode.Default
member.summary: Specifies default renderer which allows most customization through TreeGX properties. Default renderer integrates with the Style architecture to provide customization on renderer behavior.

summary.para: Specifies professional renderer. Professional renderer is custom renderer which does not rely on Style architecture for customization of renderer appearance since it provides much richer appearance than Default renderer.
Professional renderer colors can be controls through NodeProfessionalColorTable object which is exposed by NodeProfessionalRenderer.ColorTable property.

member.name: F:DevComponents.Tree.eNodeRenderMode.Custom
member.summary: Specifies that custom renderer is used. When set you must also set NodeRenderer to renderer you want to use.

member.summary: Sets the parent node.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.LinkedNode.Node
member.summary: Gets or sets reference to linked node.
member.remarks: Linked nodes are nodes that are related to given node but do not have strict parent child relationship with the node. Each linked node must be already added as child node to some other node or it will not be displayed. Linked nodes are used in Map and Diagram layout styles to indicates relationships between nodes. Also See TreeGX.LinkConnector property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.LinkedNode.ConnectorPoints
member.summary: Gets the collection of the link connector line relative points. If a node has a link to this node through LinkedNodes collection this these points outline the path connector will be drawn through from this node to it's parent linked node. By default this collection is empty which indicates that connector line is drawn using predefined path. Points added here are the points through which the connector line will travel to the parent node. The point coordinates added to this collection are relative from the top-left corner of this node.

member.name: M:DevComponents.Tree.Node.Expand
member.summary: Expands the node.
member.remarks: The Expand method expands the current Node down to the next level of nodes. The state of a Node is persisted. For example, if the next level of child nodes was not collapsed previously, when the Expand method is called, the child nodes appear in their previously expanded state.

member.name: M:DevComponents.Tree.Node.Expand(DevComponents.Tree.eTreeAction)
member.summary: Expands the node.
member.remarks: The Expand method expands the current Node down to the next level of nodes. The state of a Node is persisted. For example, if the next level of child nodes was not collapsed previously, when the Expand method is called, the child nodes appear in their previously expanded state.

member.summary: Removes the current node from the control.
member.remarks: When the Remove method is called, the node and any child nodes assigned to the Node are removed from the Tree. The removed child nodes are removed from the Tree, but are still attached to this node.

member.remarks: When the Remove method is called, the node and any child nodes assigned to the Node are removed from the Tree. The removed child nodes are removed from the Tree, but are still attached to this node.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.ContextMenu
member.summary: Gets or sets the context menu assigned to this node. Standard Context Menus, VS.NET 2005 Context Menus and DotNetBar Suite context menus are supported. Default value is null (Nothing) which indicates that no context menu is assigned.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.HasHostedControls
member.summary: Gets whether any of the cells inside the node has HostedControl property set.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.NodeRenderer
member.summary: Gets or sets custom node renderer. You can set this property to your custom renderer. When set the RenderMode should be set to custom to enable your custom renderer. To choose one of the system renderer use RenderMode property. Default value is null.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.RenderMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the render mode used to render the node. Default value is eNodeRenderMode.Default which indicates that system default renderer is used. Note that if you specify custom renderer you need to set either TreeGX.NodeRenderer or Node.NodeRenderer property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.Expanded
member.summary: Gets or sets whether node is expanded. Expanded node shows it's child nodes.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.Name
member.summary: Returns name of the node that can be used to identify it from the code.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.DragDropEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether node can be dragged and dropped. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.ExpandVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets visibility of the expand button. Default value is Auto meaning that expand button is displayed only if node has at least one child node.
member.remarks: You can use this property for example to dynamicly load the child nodes when user tries to expand the node. You could for example handle BeforeExpand event to load child nodes into the node.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.SizeChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets whether any operation on the node has been performed that would affect node's size. Size changed flag internally indicates that node's size needs to be recalculated becouse it has changed due to the changes in data.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.ContentBounds
member.summary: Gets the node content bounds.

member.summary: Gets the bounds for all the cells inside the node. The bounds do not include the expand part.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.CellsBounds
member.summary: Gets the bounds for all the cells inside the node. The bounds do not include the expand part.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.ChildNodesBounds
member.summary: Gets or sets the bounds of child nodes.

member.summary: Gets the expand part rectangle. Expand part is used to expand/collapse node.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.ExpandPartRectangle
member.summary: Gets the expand part rectangle. Expand part is used to expand/collapse node.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.CommandBounds
member.summary: Gets or sets the Command part bounds if command part is visible.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.Checked
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the tree node is in a checked state.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.CheckBoxAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the checkbox alignment in relation to the text displayed by first default cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.CheckBoxVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether check box is visible inside the cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.FullPath
member.summary: Gets the path from the root tree node to the current tree node. The path consists of the labels of all the tree nodes that must be navigated to get to this tree node, starting at the root tree node. The node labels are separated by the delimiter character specified in the PathSeparator property of the Tree control that contains this node.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.Index
member.summary: Gets the zero based index of position of the tree node in the tree node collection. -1 is returned if node is not added to the nodes collection.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.IsEditing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the tree node is in an editable state. true if the tree node is in editable state; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.IsMouseDown
member.summary: Gets whether left mouse button is pressed on any cell contained by this node.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.IsMouseOver
member.summary: Gets whether mouse cursor is over on any cell contained by this node.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.IsSelected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the tree node is in the selected state. true if the tree node is in the selected state; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.SelectedCell
member.summary: Gets or sets a cell that is in selected state otherwise it retuns null.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.IsVisible
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the tree node is visible. Node is considered to be visible when it's Visible property is set to true and path to the node is available i.e. all parent nodes are expanded.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.IsDisplayed
member.summary: Returns whether node is displayed on the screen and visible to the user. When node is outside of the viewable area this property will return false. It will also return false if node is not visible.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.LastNode
member.summary: Gets the last child tree node. The LastNode is the last child Node in the NodeCollection stored in the Nodes property of the current tree node. If the Node has no child tree node, the LastNode property returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.NextNode
member.summary: Gets the next sibling tree node. The NextNode is the next sibling Node in the NodeCollection stored in the Nodes property of the tree node's parent Node. If there is no next tree node, the NextNode property returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.NextVisibleNode
member.summary: Gets the next visible tree node. The NextVisibleNode can be a child, sibling, or a tree node from another branch. If there is no next tree node, the NextVisibleNode property returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.Nodes
member.summary: Gets the collection of Node objects assigned to the current tree node. The Nodes property can hold a collection of other Node objects. Each of the tree node in the collection has a Nodes property that can contain its own NodeCollection. Nesting of tree nodes can make it difficult to navigate a tree structure. The FullPath property makes it easier to determine your location in a tree.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.LinkedNodes
member.summary: Gets the collection of LinkedNode objects that describe nodes linked to this node.
member.remarks: Linked nodes are nodes that are related to given node but do not have strict parent child relationship with the node. Each linked node must be already added as child node to some other node or it will not be displayed. Linked nodes are used in Map and Diagram layout styles to display relationships between nodes.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.HasLinkedNodes
member.summary: Gets whether Node has any linked nodes.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.AnyVisibleNodes
member.summary: Gets whether there is at least one child node that has its Visible property set to true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent tree node of the current tree node. If the tree node is at the root level, the Parent property returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.PrevNode
member.summary: Gets the previous sibling tree node. The PrevNode is the previous sibling Node in the NodeCollection stored in the Nodes property of the tree node's parent Node. If there is no previous tree node, the PrevNode property returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.PrevVisibleNode
member.summary: Gets the previous visible tree node. The PrevVisibleNode can be a child, sibling, or a tree node from another branch. If there is no previous tree node, the PrevVisibleNode property returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that contains data about the tree node. Any Object derived type can be assigned to this property. If this property is being set through the Windows Forms designer, only text can be assigned.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.TagString
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that contains data about the tree node. Any Object derived type can be assigned to this property. If this property is being set through the Windows Forms designer, only text can be assigned.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.DataKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that contains additional data about the tree node. Any Object derived type can be assigned to this property. If this property is being set through the Windows Forms designer, only text can be assigned. This property has same function as Tag property and provides you with additional separate storage of data.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.DataKeyString
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that contains additional data about the tree node. Any Object derived type can be assigned to this property. If this property is being set through the Windows Forms designer, only text can be assigned. This property has same function as Tag property and provides you with additional separate storage of data.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text displayed in the tree node.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.HostedControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the control hosted inside of the first node cell.

remarks.para: When control is hosted inside of the cell, cell size is determined by the size of the control hosted inside of it. The cell will not display its text but it will display any image assigned or check box when control is hosted inside of it. The Style settings like Margin and Padding will still apply.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.TreeControl
member.summary: Gets the parent tree control that the tree node is assigned to.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.CellLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the layout of the cells inside the node. Default value is Horizontal layout which means that cell are positioned horizontally next to each other.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.CellPartLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the layout of the cell parts like check box, image and text. Layout can be horizontal (default) where parts of the cell are positioned next to each other horizontally, or vertical where parts of the cell are positioned on top of each other vertically. Alignment of the each part is controlled by alignment properties. This property affects only the first cell inside of the node. Use Cell.Layout property to change the part layout on each cell contained by node.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.Cells
member.summary: Gets the collection of all Cells assigned to this node. There should be always at least one cell in a node which is default cell. Default collection contains a single cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.NodesColumns
member.summary: Get collection of child node columns.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.StyleExpanded
member.summary: Gets or sets the style of the cells when node is expanded.
member.value: Reference to the style assigned to the node/cell or null value indicating that default style setting from tree control is applied. Default value is null.

remarks.para: When node is expanded the style specified here will be used on all cells associated with this node instead of the Cell.StyleNormal. That way you can give different appearance to your node's cells when node is expanded.
When property is set to null value the style setting from parent tree controls is used. NodeStyleExpanded on TreeGX control is a root style for a cell.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.StyleExpandedName
member.summary: Gets or sets the expanded style name used by node. This member is provided for internal use only. To set or get the style use StyleExpanded property instead.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.StyleSelected
member.summary: Gets or sets the style used when Node is selected. Default value is NULL (VB Nothing)

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.StyleSelectedName
member.summary: Gets or sets the selected style name used by node. This member is provided for internal use only. To set or get the style use StyleSelected property instead.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.StyleMouseOver
member.summary: Gets or sets the style used when mouse is over the Node. Default value is NULL (VB Nothing)

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.StyleMouseOverName
member.summary: Gets or sets the mouse over style name used by node. This member is provided for internal use only. To set or get the style use StyleMouseOver property instead.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the node style.
member.value: Reference to the style assigned to the node or null value indicating that default style setting from tree control is applied. Default value is null.

remarks.para: Style specified by this property will be used as default style for the node. Each cell within the node can also specify it's own style. Since node contains the cells using this style property can you for example create a border around all cell contained by the node.
When this property is set to null value (default value) NodeStyle property on TreeGX control is used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.StyleName
member.summary: Gets or sets the style name used by node. This member is provided for internal use only. To set or get the style use Style property instead.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.MouseOverNodePart
member.summary: Gets or sets the part of the node mouse is over.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.Offset
member.summary: Gets or sets the node horizontal offset from the position determined by the layout manager.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.MapSubRootPosition
member.summary: Gets layout position of the node when tree is in Map layout mode and node is the first child note of top-level root node. To set the layout position for a node use TreeGX.SetNodeMapPosition method.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.ImageAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the image alignment in relation to the text displayed by cell. This property affects only first default cell inside the node. Property with same name is available on each cell and you can use it to affect each cell individually.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.Image
member.summary: Gets or sets the image displayed when the tree node is in the unselected state.
member.remarks: Image specified will be used as a default image for any other node state where different image is not specified.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.ImageIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the image-list index value of the default image that is displayed by the tree nodes.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.ImageMouseOver

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.ImageMouseOverIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the image-list index value of the image that is displayed by the tree nodes when mouse is over the node.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.ImageExpanded
member.summary: Gets or sets the image displayed when node is expanded.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.ImageExpandedIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the image-list index value of the image that is displayed by the tree nodes when node is expanded.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.ParentConnector
member.summary: Gets or sets the NodeConnector object that describes the type of the connector used for displaying connection between current node and its parent node. Default value is null which means that settings from TreeGX control are used.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.Node.ParentConnectorPoints
member.summary: Gets the collection of the parent connector line relative points. By default this collection is empty which indicates that connector line is drawn using predefined path. Points added here are the points through which the connector line will travel to the parent node. The point coordinates added to this collection are relative from the top-left corner of this node.

member.summary: Returns full path to the given node.
member.returns: Full path to the node.

member.name: M:DevComponents.Tree.NodeOperations.GetLastNode(DevComponents.Tree.Node)
member.summary: Gets the last child tree node. The LastNode is the last child Node in the NodeCollection stored in the Nodes property of the current tree node. If the Node has no child tree node, the LastNode property returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.returns: Last node if found or null if there is no last node.

member.name: M:DevComponents.Tree.NodeOperations.GetNextNode(DevComponents.Tree.Node)
member.summary: Gets the next sibling tree node. The NextNode is the next sibling Node in the NodeCollection stored in the Nodes property of the tree node's parent Node. If there is no next tree node, the NextNode property returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.returns: Node object or null if node cannot be found.

member.name: M:DevComponents.Tree.NodeOperations.GetNextVisibleSibling(DevComponents.Tree.Node)
member.summary: Returns next visible sibling tree node.
member.returns: Node object or null if next visible node cannot be found

member.name: M:DevComponents.Tree.NodeOperations.GetNextVisibleNode(DevComponents.Tree.Node)
member.summary: Gets the next visible tree node. The NextVisibleNode can be a child, sibling, or a tree node from another branch. If there is no next tree node, the NextVisibleNode property returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.returns: Node object or null if node cannot be found.

member.name: M:DevComponents.Tree.NodeOperations.GetIsNodeVisible(DevComponents.Tree.Node)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the tree node is visible. Node is considered to be visible when it's Visible property is set to true and path to the node is available i.e. all parent nodes are expanded.

member.name: M:DevComponents.Tree.NodeOperations.GetIsNodeDisplayed(DevComponents.Tree.Node)
member.summary: Returns whether node is displayed on the screen and visible to the user. When node is outside of the viewable area this property will return false. It will also return false if node is not visible.

member.name: M:DevComponents.Tree.NodeOperations.GetNodeIndex(DevComponents.Tree.Node)
member.summary: Gets the zero based index of position of the tree node in the tree node collection. -1 is returned if node is not added to the nodes collection.
member.returns: Zero based index or -1 if node is not in collection.

member.name: M:DevComponents.Tree.NodeOperations.GetPreviousNode(DevComponents.Tree.Node)
member.summary: Gets the previous sibling tree node. The PrevNode is the previous sibling Node in the NodeCollection stored in the Nodes property of the tree node's parent Node. If there is no previous tree node, the PrevNode property returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.returns: Node object or null if node cannot be found.

member.name: M:DevComponents.Tree.NodeOperations.GetPreviousVisibleNode(DevComponents.Tree.Node)
member.summary: Gets the previous visible tree node. The PrevVisibleNode can be a child, sibling, or a tree node from another branch. If there is no previous tree node, the PrevVisibleNode property returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.returns: Node object or null if node cannot be found.

member.name: M:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.Refresh
member.summary: Forces the control to invalidate its client area and immediately redraw itself and any child controls. Note however that this method will node do anything if refresh is suspended as result of call to BeginUpdate method without corresponding EndUpdate call or if SuspendPaint property is set to true.

member.name: M:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.SetNodeMapPosition(DevComponents.Tree.Node,DevComponents.Tree.eMapPosition)
member.summary: Sets the node map position when tree is in Map layout mode. The node's position can be set only for the sub-root nodes, i.e. nodes that are parented directly to top-level root node. Setting map position for any other node does not have any effect.

remarks.para: Note that setting map position explicitly can change the position for other nodes that are on the same level as the node that you pass into this method. Since Map mode layouts the nodes clock-wise, setting the node position to Near will cause all nodes that are in collection after the reference node to be positioned Near as well.
Similarly, setting the node position to Far will cause all nodes that are in collection before the reference node to be positioned Far as well.

member.param: Sub-root node to set layout position for.
The position relative to the root node should take

member.name: M:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Disables any redrawing of the tree control. To maintain performance while items are added one at a time to the control, call the BeginUpdate method. The BeginUpdate method prevents the control from painting until the EndUpdate method is called.

member.name: M:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.EndUpdate
member.summary: Enables the redrawing of the tree view. To maintain performance while items are added one at a time to the control, call the BeginUpdate method. The BeginUpdate method prevents the control from painting until the EndUpdate method is called.
member.remarks: Call to EndUpdate will enable the layout and painting in tree control. If there are any pending layouts the EndUpdate will call RecalcLayout method to perform the layout and it will repaint the control.

member.name: M:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.EndUpdate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables the redrawing of the tree view. To maintain performance while items are added one at a time to the control, call the BeginUpdate method. The BeginUpdate method prevents the control from painting until the EndUpdate method is called.
member.param: Gets or sets whether layout and refresh of control is performed if there are no other update blocks pending.

member.summary: Occurs just before the cell editing is ended. The text box for editing is still visible and you can cancel the exit out of editing mode at this point. The order of the cell editing events is as follows: BeforeCellEdit, CellEditEnding, AfterCellEdit.

member.summary: Occurs after cell editing has ended and before the new text entered by the user is assigned to the cell. You can abort the edits in this event. The order of the cell editing events is as follows: BeforeCellEdit, CellEditEnding, AfterCellEdit.

member.name: E:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.SerializeNode
member.summary: Occurs after an node has been serialized to XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to add any custom data to serialized XML. This allows you to serialize any data associated with the node and load it back up in DeserializeNode event.

remarks.para: To serialize custom data to XML definition control creates handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeNodeEventArgs to add new nodes or set attributes with custom data you want saved.

member.name: E:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.DeserializeNode
member.summary: Occurs after an node has been de-serialized (loaded) from XmlElement and provides you with opportunity to load any custom data you have serialized during SerializeItem event.

remarks.para: To de-serialize custom data from XML definition handle this event and use CustomXmlElement property on SerializeItemEventArgs to retrive any data you saved in SerializeNode event.

member.summary: Gets or sets zoom factor for the control. Default value is 1. To zoom display of the nodes for 20% set zoom factor to 1.2 To zoom view 2 times set zoom factor to 2. Value must be greater than 0.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.NodeRenderer
member.summary: Gets or sets custom node renderer. You can set this property to your custom renderer. When set the RenderMode should be set to Custom to enable your custom renderer. To choose one of the system renderer use RenderMode property. Default value is null.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.RenderMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the render mode used to render all nodes. Default value is eNodeRenderMode.Default which indicates that system default renderer is used. Note that if you specify custom renderer you need to set TreeGX.NodeRenderer property to your custom renderer.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.Columns
member.summary: Gets the collection of all column headers that appear in the tree.

remarks.para: By default there are no column headers defined. In that case tree control functions as regular tree control where text has unrestricted width.
If you want to restrict the horizontal width of the text but not display column header you can create one column and set its width to the width desired and set its Visible property to false.

remarks.para: If no Node is currently selected, the SelectedNode property is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.NodeLayout
member.summary: Returns reference to node layout object.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.NodeDisplay
member.summary: Returns reference to node display object.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.IsUpdateSuspended
member.summary: Gets whether layout is suspended for tree control. Layout is suspended after call to BeginUpdate method and it is resumed after the call to EndUpdate method.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.SuspendPaint
member.summary: Gets or sets whether paint operations are suspended for the control. You should use this method if you need the RecalcLayout operations to proceed but you want to stop painting of the control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.ImageList
member.summary: Gets or sets the ImageList that contains the Image objects used by the tree nodes.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.ImageIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the image-list index value of the default image that is displayed by the tree nodes.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.RootConnector
member.summary: Gets or sets the NodeConnector object that describes the type of the connector used for displaying connection between root node and it's nested nodes. The root node is defined as the top level node i.e. which belongs directly to TreeGX.Nodes collection. Default value is null.
member.remarks: You can use Node.ParentConnector property to specify per node connectors.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.NodesConnector
member.summary: Gets or sets the NodeConnector object that describes the type of the connector used for displaying connection between nested nodes. RootConnector property specifies the connector between root node and it's imidate nested nodes. This property specifies connector for all other nested levels. Default value is null.
member.remarks: You can use Node.ParentConnector property to specify per node connectors.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.LinkConnector
member.summary: Gets or sets the NodeConnector object that describes the type of the connector used for displaying connection between linked nodes. This property specifies connector for all linked nodes. Default value is null.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.SelectedPathConnector
member.summary: Gets or sets the NodeConnector object that describes the type of the connector used for displaying connection between linked nodes. Connector specified here is used to display the connection between nodes that are on the path to the selected node. When set you can use it to visually indicate the path to the currently selected node. Default value is null.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.CellLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the layout of the cells inside the node. Default value is Horizontal layout which means that cell are positioned horizontally next to each other.
member.remarks: You can specify cell layout on each node by using Node.CellLayout property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.CellPartLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the layout of the cells inside the node. Default value is Horizontal layout which means that cell are positioned horizontally next to each other.
member.remarks: You can specify cell layout on each node by using Node.CellLayout property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.ColorSchemeStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the color scheme style. Color scheme provides predefined colors based on popular visual styles. We recommend that you use "SchemePart" color settings since they maintain consistant look that is based on target system color scheme setting.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.ColorScheme
member.summary: Gets the reference to the color scheme object.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.CenterContent
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the content of the control is centered within the bounds of control. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.SelectionBox
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates whether selection box is drawn around the selected node. Default value is true. Another way to provide the visual indication that node is selected is by using selected state style properties like NodeStyleSelected and CellStyleSelected.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.SelectionBoxSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size/thickness in pixel of the selection box drawn around selected node.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.SelectionBoxBorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the selection box border color.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.SelectionBoxFillColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the selection box fill color.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.ExpandButtonSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the expand button that is used to expand/collapse node. Default value is 8,8.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.ExpandBorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets expand button border color. Note that setting ExpandBorderColorSchemePart property will override the value that you set here.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.ExpandBorderColorSchemePart
member.summary: Gets or sets expand button color scheme border color. Setting this property overrides the setting of the corresponding ExpandBorderColor property. Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through ExpandBorderColor property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.ExpandBackColor

member.summary: Gets or sets the expand button image which is used to indicate that node will be expanded. To use images as expand buttons you also need to set ExpandButtonType=eExpandButtonType.Image.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.ExpandImageCollapse
member.summary: Gets or sets the expand button image which is used to indicate that node will be collapsed. To use images as expand buttons you also need to set ExpandButtonType=eExpandButtonType.Image.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.ExpandButtonType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the expand button used to expand/collapse nodes.

member.name: P:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGX.DisplayRootNode
member.summary: Gets or sets the display root node. For example in Map or Diagram layout single node is always used as root node for display. Setting this property allows you to use any Node as root display node. Default value is Null which means that first node from TreeGX.Nodes collection is used as display root node.

member.name: F:DevComponents.Tree.TreeGXNodeCollectionEventArgs.ParentNode
member.summary: Indicates parent node of the affected node. For example if event handled is BeforeNodeInsert parent of the Node is has not been set yet so this property provides information on the node that will become parent. If this property returns null then node is being added or removed from the main TreeGX.Nodes collection.
